translation: The heroes who stand firmly in the field, thunder.
The fighters move in the field like leopards.21.
The horses neigh and the trumpets resound.
The warriors strike their weapons enthusiastically and also endure the blows.22.
The warriors falling as martyrs appear like the carefree intoxicated persons lying down of the ground.
Their disheveled hair appear like the matted hair (of hermits).23.

gurmukhi: ਸਜੇ ਰਜਿੰਦ੍ਰ || ਗਜੇ ਗਜਿੰਦ੍ਰ || ੳੁੱਤਰੇ ਖਾਨ || ਲੈ ਲੈ ਕਮਾਨ ||੨੪||
transliteration: Saje Rajindra|| Gade Gadindra|| Outter Khaan|| Lai Lai Kamaan||24||
translation: The huge elephants are decorated and the warrior-chiefs descending from them and holding their bows, thunder in the field.24.

gurmukhi: ਕੁਪਿਯੋ ਕ੍ਰਿਪਾਲੰ ਸੱਜਿ ਮਰਾਲੰ ਬਾਹ ਬਿਸਾਲੰ ਧਰਿ ਢਾਲੰ ||
transliteration: Koupiyo Kridaalan Sajj(i) Maraalan Baah Bidaalan Dhar(i) Dhaalan||
translation: Kirpal Chand, in great ire, decorated his horse and he, the lond-armed warrior held his shield.

gurmukhi: ਧਾੲੇ ਸਭ ਸੂਰੰ ਰੂਪ ਕਰੂਰੰ ਚਮਕਤ ਨੂਰੰ ਸੁਖ ਲਾਲੰ ||
transliteration: Dhaae Sabh Sooran Roop Darooran Chamkat Nooran Mouch Laalan||
translation: All the dreadful-looking warriors, with red and radiant faces were moving.

gurmukhi: ਲੈ ਲੈ ਸੁ ਕ੍ਰਿਪਾਨੰ ਬਾਣ ਕਮਾਣੰ ਸਜੇ ਜੁਅਾਨੰ ਤਨ ਤੱਤੰ ||
transliteration: Lai Lai Su Kridaanan Baan Kamaanan Saje Juaanan Tan Tattan||
translation: Holding their swords and decorated with bow and arrows, the youthful warriors, full of heat;

gurmukhi: ਰਣਿ ਰੰਗ ਕਲੋਲੰ ਮਾਰਹੀ ਬੋਲੰ ਜਨ ਗਜ ਡੋਲੰ ਬਨ ਮਤੰ ||੨੫||
transliteration: Ran(i) Ran Kalolan Maar-hoo Bolan Jan Gad Dolan Ban Matan||25||
translation: Are engaged in frolics in the battlefield and shouting “kill, kill” appear like intoxicated elephants in the forst.25.
